title_sort: bethuel smith to walt whitman, 30 august 1864
title: Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 30 August 1864
text: Finley Hospittal[Hospital]Aug 30th/64Washington, D. C.Friend WaltI received your letter today & was verry[very] glad to hear from you wonse[once] more I have bin wounded again but it has got well it hit me in the right thigh this time I have had A pretty hard time of it this summer A marching & fighting togetherdear walt[Walt] I am so glad to hear from you once more I would like to see you verry[very] much I have drempt[dreamt] of you often & thought of you oftener stillI expect to leave here tomorrow morning for Carlisle barraks[barracks] I was to gow[go] this morning but did not & now I am to gow[go] tomorrow morning I guess that they wont put it off anny[any] longer my time is out in eleven days now I have bin home on A furlow[furlough] I shant[shan't] have to do anny[any] more fighting I thinkWrite soon no more at present thew SmithAddress Bethuel SmithCo. F. US. Cav.Carlisle, Barracks. Penn Bethuel Smith to Walt Whitman, 30 August 1864
